children.name: savings account
examples: an account in a bank or similar financial organization which earns interest

children.name: deposit account
children.definition: nounUK(USsavings account) tài khoản tiết kiệm
examples: a bank account in which you usually leave money
for a long time and which pays you interest

children.name: account
examples: [ C ] (alsobank account) an arrangement with a bank to keep your money there andto allow you to take it out when you need to
_I'veopenedan accountwitha building society.
_I paid the money into my account this morning.
_UKShepaid the cheque into/USShedeposited the check inher account.
_I need todrawsome moneyout ofmy account.
bank accountnoun[ C ]tài khoản ngân hàng
an arrangement with a bank where the customer puts in and removes money and thebank keeps a record of it

children.name: current account
examples: tiền gởi ngân hàng lấy ra được nhưng thường không trả lãi trước kỳ hạn
a bank account that you can take money from at any time and which usually earns little or no interest

children.name: checking account
examples: US forcurrent account

children.name: give money in exchange of money
change
examples: đổi tiền( thành đơn vị nhỏ hơn hay loại tiền khác )
[ T ] to get or give money in exchange for money, either because you want it in smaller units, or because you want the same value in foreign money
_Could you change a £10 note (fortwo fives), please?
_Could you change a £5 noteforme?
_I need to change my dollarsfor/intoEnglish money.

children.name: cash
children.definition: verb trả tiền mặt, lĩnh tiền mặt
examples: to exchange acheque, etc. for cash
_Would you cash a cheque for me?

children.name: credit
children.definition: verbMONEY trả tiền vào tài khoản
examples: [ T ] to pay money into a bank account
_They credited my accountwith$20 after I pointed out the mistake.

children.name: debit
children.definition: verb ghi (một món nợ) vào sổ nợ
examples: to take money out of an account or keep a record of this
_The bank debited my account.
_The bank debited the moneyfrommy account.
_The unauthorised borrowing fee will be debitedtoyour account.

children.name: be in the black
children.definition: If a bank account is in the black, it contains some money, and if a person orbusiness is in the black, they have money in the bank and are not in debt.

children.name: chequebook
examples: a book of cheques with your name printed on them which is given to you by your bankto make payments with

children.name: foreign exchange
children.definition: noun(hệ thống mua và bán) ngoại tệ; ngoại hối
examples: the system by which the type of money used in one country is exchanged for another country's money, making international trade easier
_On the foreign-exchange markets the pound remained firm.

children.name: bank statement
children.definition: statementnoun báo cáo của ngân hàng; bảng kê của ngân hàng (bản in sẵn có ghi toàn bộ số tiền nhập và xuất ở tài khoản của khách hàng trong một kỳ hạn nhất định
examples: (alsobank statement) a piece of paper which shows the amounts of money paid into and taken out of your bank account during a particular period of time
bank statementnoun[ C ] báo cáo của ngân hàng; bảng kê của ngân hàng
khoản của khách hàng trong một kỳ hạn nhất định
a printed record of the money put into and removed from abank account

children.name: on deposit
children.definition: describes money which is saved in a bank or something similar
examples: _I've got £5000 on deposit in the building society.

children.name: exchange rate
examples: the rate at which the money of one country can be changed for the money of another country
rate of exchangenoun[ C ] tỷ giá hối đoái
the exchange rate

children.name: banking
children.definition: noun nghiệp vụ ngân hàng; hoạt động ngân hàng; nghiệp vụ điều hành ngân hàng; ngành ngân hàng
examples: the business of operating a bank
_international banking.

children.name: internet banking
examples: the system that allows you to put in or take out money from a bank account by using the Internet

children.name: money market
examples: the system in which banks and other similar organizations buy and sell money from each other

children.name: phone banking
examples: when customers use the telephone to get to an automatic system which allows them to organize, examine and make changes to their bank accounts, or when banks operate a system of this type
_They recently launched a new phone bankingservice.

children.name: peopeo who's in charge of a bank
bank manager
children.definition: noun trưởng chi nhánh ngân hàng
examples: the person in charge of a local bank
_I got an angry letter from my bank manager the other day.

children.name: banker
children.definition: noun chủ ngân hàng; giám đốc ngân hàng
examples: someone with an important position in a bank
_She was a successful banker by the time she was forty.

children.name: sort code
children.definition: noun (alsosorting code) mã số định dạng ngân hàng; mã ngân hàng
examples: an official number used to refer to a particular bank

children.name: PIN
examples: mã số riêng của từng khách hàng khi rút tiền trong máy ATM; mã PIN; số PIN
formal forPIN (number)
PIN ( number)noun[ C ]
abbreviation forpersonal identification number : a secret
numberwhich a person uses together with a special card to get moneyfrom their bank account from a machine outside the bank

children.name: credit
examples: [ C or U ] money in your bank account
_I was relieved to see from my statement that my account wasincredit.

children.name: deposit
children.definition: nounMONEY khoản tiền gửi (ở ngân hàng)
examples: [ C ] a payment, especially into a bank account
_To open an account, you need tomakea minimum depositof$500.

children.name: bank balance
examples: the amount of money in a bank account
_I'd like tocheckmy bank balance, please.

children.name: bank charges
examples: sums of money paid by a customer for a bank's services
_You'll pay some hefty bank charges if you go overdrawn without permission.

children.name: to put money in a bank
pay sth in
examples: to put money into a bank account
_If you go to the bank, will you pay these cheques in for me?

children.name: bank
children.definition: verbMONEY gửi ngân hàng; gửi tiền vào ngân hàng
examples: [ I or T ] to keep your money in a particular bank, or to put money into a bank
_I used to bankwithLloyd's.

children.name: put in
examples: ▪ How much did you put in?
put something in the bank/an account:gửi cái gì đó vào trong ngân hàng/tài khoản
▪ I put $50 in my bank every week.
▪ Any money that you put in your account will immediately start earning interest.
put money/a cheque/£100/$200 etc in: bỏ tiền/chi phiếu/£100/$200... trong
▪ When did you put the money in?

children.name: deposit
children.definition: /dɪˈpɒzɪt, dɪˈpɒzətǁdɪˈpɑː-/  to put money into a bank account - used especially by people who work in banks:
examples: ▪ The money is deposited in my account every month.
▪ Our records show that you deposited $200 in your account on January 17th.

children.name: bank
examples: abuildingwherepeople and businesses caninvestor borrow money,change it toforeign money, etc.
_High street banks have been accused of exploiting small firms.
_I need to go to the bank at lunch time.
_I had to take out a bankloanto start my own business.

children.name: a bank and kinds of bank
bank
examples: anorganizationwhere people and businesses caninvestor borrow money,change it toforeign money, etc.
_High street banks have been accused of exploiting small firms.
_I need to go to the bank at lunch time.
_I had to take out a bankloanto start my own business.

children.name: merchant bank
examples: a bank which does business with companies rather than with people

children.name: investment bank
examples: a bank that helps companies sell and buyshares, or helps them to buy other companies ormerge(= join together) with each other

children.name: central bank
children.definition: noun ngân hàng trung ươngcủa một quốc gia,
examples: a bank that provides services to a national government, puts the official financial plansof that government into operation, and controls the amount of money in the economy

children.name: savings bank
children.definition: noun ngân hàng tiết kiệm; quỹ tiết kiệm
examples: a bank which only offers accounts where your money earns interest

children.name: clearing bank
examples: a bank which exchangeschequeswith other banks through a central organization called aclearing house

children.name: electronic banking
examples: when customers use the Internet to organize, examine and make changes to their bankaccounts andinvestments, etc. electronically, or when banks operate accounts and services in this way
_electronic bankingservices

children.name: debit
children.definition: noun khoảnghi nợ( từ tài khoản ra ) / phiếu ghi nợ
examples: (a record of) money taken out of a bank account
_The account wasindebit at the end of the month (= more money had been spent than was in the account at that time) .
_Debits are shown in the left-hand column.

children.name: debit
examples: to take money out of an account or keep a record of this
_The bank debited my account.
_The bank debited the moneyfrommy account.
_The unauthorised borrowing fee will be debitedtoyour account.
